mixed-citation.article-title: Taxonomic review of the genus Erythrocricus Schubart, 1962 (Diplopoda, Spirobolida, Rhinocricidae)

tp:treatment-sec.p:
Erythrocricus electrofasciatus
resembles
E. sanguineostriatus
in the characteristics cited above for the diagnosis of
E . sanguineostriatus
but differs by the general coloration ( Fig. 4 ) and by the transverse red line only on the posterior metazonites. Coxae of leg pair 3 with a pointed apex ( Fig. 4B ); the telopodite of the anterior gonopod is well developed in posterior view ( Fig. 5B ), the external branch of the posterior gonopod lamellated and narrow, distally long and slender ( Fig. 5C ).

tp:treatment-sec.p: MEASUREMENTS. 1 ♂ , MZUFMT-MYR 0481: with 52p+T. Total length 60.0 mm, maximum width of midbody rings 5.7 mm .

HEAD AND BODY RING ( Fig. 4 ). Antennae with numerous apical sensory cones. Collum rounded laterally. Tegument smooth, without setae. Ozopores starting from 6 th ring. Scobinae starting from 7 th ring, concave.
Coloration as in male ( Fig. 4D–E ), with 50p+T. Total length 61.0 mm. Width 5.4 mm .
Known from Serra do Cachimbo, states of Pará , and state of Mato Grosso .
